content.raw:
I haven't tested it, but having a quick look at the [implementation](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/0cab91fe6b2bcd35a92390e85b8f730d691912dc/src/Element.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#Element.cc-587), I believe the answers are as follows. (These questions would make interesting test cases.)

1. No
1. It will take the first joint sibling of the link element, which comes after the link
1. No

Another interesting detail is that if an empty string is passed, the next sibling will be returned, no matter what it is.
content.html:
I haven't tested it, but having a quick look at the implementation, I believe the answers are as follows. (These questions would make interesting test cases.)

  1. No
  2. It will take the first joint sibling of the link element, which comes after the link
  3. No

Another interesting detail is that if an empty string is passed, the next sibling will be returned, no matter what it is.
